title: Unable to connect to the server
body:
Hi guys,

I don't know if this is just a me thing, or that its happening to many people but for the last few days (since April 2nd really, was ok on April 1st) I'm finding it extremely hard to connect to games. I can log in fine and use the store without any issues, but when I try to connect to games I keep getting hit with the "unable to connect to the server" error. If I persist with waiting and just continuously retrying it eventually lets me connect though sometimes this has taken upwards of 6-7 minutes. I used to get this error like 9 months ago and ever since had swapped to launching the client in admin mode and using the admin version of the executable which had seemingly fixed the problem. Nothing has changed at my end set up wise, but this has been getting really annoying so I thought I'd ask if this was something others were also having problems with? Is it something server side like too many people wanting to play URF?

replies.body:
Sorry for the late response, I had the same issue recently, and found out how to fix it. If it's still a problem (and for anyone else who wants to know), here's how to fix it:

(windows 7 (should be similar in other windows versions))
1. open control panel
2. open 'system and security' tab
3. open 'windows firewall'
4. on the left hand side, click 'allow a program....')
5. click 'change settings'
6. locate League of Legends (either on the list, or by pressing 'allow another program', and finding it there)
7. check every box you can, and click OK
8. now, on the left, click 'advanced settings'
9. on the left choose 'inbound rules'
10. locate League of Legends, and if there are any grey ones; right click them and choose 'activate rule'
11. once all of the League of Legends ones (probably about 4) are green, you should be good to go - at least it worked for me ;)
(My OS language is not in english, and couldn't be bothered to change it, so I just translated all the names in ' ' - the names might not be 100% what I wrote here)

The amount of people playing has not changed since the introduction of URF, unless you count in the fact that there were holidays recently, but even then it's not that much.

Have you tried it out [using a different DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5)?
